intro: Gyrostachys romanzoffiana, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces tiny, pink to white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
